channel.title: Question
channel.description:
I'm trying to master networking but I've ran across something I cannot find an answer for.
Let's say, we have 3 computers, all of them have a private IP, wich is converted into the same public IP via NAT with a router. Let's say, all three have a server on the same port. Now when a client tries to connect to the server using the server's IP and port, what will happen? And what won't and why.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

Assuming they’re all behind the same NAT gateway, then two of them would fail in binding to that port externally.

Read full topic
